channel.title: Optimus Expectations
channel.description:
[b]Note:[/b] Please move this if you think it's in the wrong section.
For those of you who may not know, Jagex is planning a second bot nuke update. Not that it really affects most of us but there is also something troubling that I heard with there being a secondary sort of mapdata that will have to be used with interfaces. That would be crippling towards RSPS development because it'd be near impossible to create features without the interfaces. What do you guys plan to expect and how do you think the client will function after this point. I heard rumors of direct memory mapping of objects through pointers to access and modify them which means the client might have more native pieces to it.
Jagex has always had the ability to encrypt their files in their file system but never have except for map files. Why would they start doing that for interfaces now of all times? The approximate revision they started enciphering map files was 414.
http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Optimus

item.title: Optimus Expectations
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“mopman_sucks, post:6, topic:445081”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=547769.msg4016334#msg4016334 date=1339666209]

i’m pretty sure optimus is the use of ‘sun.misc.Unsafe’ for direct memory access & that it’s (in a basic (perhaps not even used) version) been in the client for at minimum a few weeks

  • it’s been well more than 3 years silabsoft

no they havn’t been using XTEA encryption on the map data for over 3 years.

The approximate revision they started enciphering map files was 414.

9 Feb 2007 was 448 so it’s been about 5 years?
[/quote]
I was under the impression the usage of the XTEA cipher was after 508 414 they stopped doing a fullfetch of the cache for the map data and went strictly to on demand did they not?[/quote]

414 has mapdata, this was the revision that the cache system changed to be what it is currently today.

Read full topic

item.title: Optimus Expectations
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Hmm, even if it does mean that we can’t get new interfaces its no big deal… Can just use the old one, all these new revisions are ALWAYS half finished, bugged to hell etc. This gives people time to actually improve what they currently have rather than constantly upgrading while other people crack the cache so all in all its not that bad.
I’ve honestly been waiting for optimus to happen since march, looking forward to it. Hopefully they’ll be some events like last time, new combat and bots will be gfed for a while again = sounds good.

Read full topic

item.title: Optimus Expectations
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Jagex started encrypting map data about 3 years ago now and its blatant effort to prevent private servers. Ofcourse it would make sense to also do the same to the interfaces because most interfaces are only accessible once if you encrypt them then private servers will not be able to retrieve the data without a lot of data mining.

This is a great update for Jagex as they are effectively killing two birds with one stone.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Note: Please move this if you think it’s in the wrong section.

For those of you who may not know, Jagex is planning a second bot nuke update. Not that it really affects most of us but there is also something troubling that I heard with there being a secondary sort of mapdata that will have to be used with interfaces. That would be crippling towards RSPS development because it’d be near impossible to create features without the interfaces. What do you guys plan to expect and how do you think the client will function after this point. I heard rumors of direct memory mapping of objects through pointers to access and modify them which means the client might have more native pieces to it.

Jagex has always had the ability to encrypt their files in their file system but never have except for map files. Why would they start doing that for interfaces now of all times? The approximate revision they started enciphering map files was 414.

RuneScape Wiki

Optimus

Optimus was perceived to be a second Bot Nuke originally planned for release in March, but was delayed until 3 May 2012, when Jagex implemented it. Mod Philip confirmed in the Game Engine& CM Q&A of 13 April 2012 that they are working on Optimus and...

Read full topic
